doc.summary: Gets the default value for places where elements with this editor are created that have  no value set.
doc.text: Gets the default value for places where elements with this editor are created that have  no value set.

parameters.name: screen
parameters.doc: The screen used for display. This screen must be used if the widget wants to draw tooltips, or they won't work correctly.

parameters.name: initialValue
parameters.doc: The initial value for the created widget.

doc.summary: Creates a widget for a given initial value.
doc.text: Creates a widget for a given initial value.

parameters.name: screen
parameters.doc: The screen used for display. This screen must be used if the widget wants to draw tooltips, or they won't work correctly.

parameters.name: old
parameters.doc: The old widget that was created before, either by <ref cls="org/moddingx/libx/config/gui/ConfigEditor" method="createWidget" type="(net.minecraft.client.gui.screens.Screen,T,org.moddingx.libx.config.gui.WidgetProperties<T>)net.minecraft.client.gui.components.AbstractWidget">#createWidget</ref> or by this method.

doc.summary: Updates a previously created widget for example after a screen resize.
doc.text: Updates a previously created widget for example after a screen resize.

parameters.name: defaultValue
parameters.doc: The value that should be used as default value.

doc.summary: Creates a new editor that states, that a value can't be edited through the GUI.
doc.text: Creates a new editor that states, that a value can't be edited through the GUI.

doc.summary: Creates a new editor that represents an option of another editor by adding a checkbox to  select whether a value is set or not.
doc.text: Creates a new editor that represents an option of another editor by adding a checkbox to  select whether a value is set or not.

doc.summary: Creates a toggle editor for a set of elements.
doc.text: Creates a toggle editor for a set of elements. This can be a single button that cycles on click  or a sub screen so select the element, depending on the amount of elements given.

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc: A function that defines how to convert elements into a <ref cls="net/minecraft/network/chat/Component">Component</ref> for display.

doc.summary: Creates a toggle editor for a set of elements.
doc.text: Creates a toggle editor for a set of elements. This can be a single button that cycles on click  or a sub screen so select the element, depending on the amount of elements given.

doc.summary: Creates a new text input editor.
doc.text: Creates a new text input editor.

parameters.name: validator
parameters.doc: Validator information used. This causes the widget to go red when invalid values are entered.

doc.summary: Creates a new text input editor.
doc.text: Creates a new text input editor.

parameters.name: input
parameters.doc: Information on which input to allow and how to process that input.

doc.summary: Creates a new text input editor.
doc.text: Creates a new text input editor.

parameters.name: input
parameters.doc: Information on which input to allow and how to process that input.

parameters.name: validator
parameters.doc: Validator information used. This causes the widget to go red when invalid values are entered.

doc.summary: Creates a new text input editor.
doc.text: Creates a new text input editor.

parameters.name: extractor
parameters.doc: A function that extracts a value from a <ref cls="java/lang/Double">double</ref> between 0 and 1

parameters.name: factory
parameters.doc: A function that turns a <ref cls="java/lang/Double">double</ref> between 0 and 1 into a value

doc.summary: Creates a new editor for a slider.
doc.text: Creates a new editor for a slider.

parameters.name: contentFactory
parameters.doc: A function that creates a new screen content from a given initial value.

doc.summary: Creates a config editor with a button that will then open a sub-screen based on the  given <ref cls="org/moddingx/libx/config/gui/ConfigScreenContent">content</ref>.
doc.text: Creates a config editor with a button that will then open a sub-screen based on the  given <ref cls="org/moddingx/libx/config/gui/ConfigScreenContent">content</ref>.

doc.summary: A config editor provides the logic on how to display a config value in a GUI.
doc.text:
A config editor provides the logic on how to display a config value in a GUI. The config editor may not store additional state, as the same editor can be used for multiple entries.
However, the widgets created by an editor can store state.
